shift in leadership, Google co-founder Larry Page will take charge of the company's day-to-day operations as chief executive officer, replacing current CEO Eric Schmidt , who will focus on strategic projects, in particular new products. long EU probe: report LONDON( Reuters)- Google Inc. wants to avoid a lengthy legal battle with European Union regulators investigating its market dominance, the Sunday Telegraph quoted its chief executive as saying. We certainly want to avoid that, Eric Schmidt told the paper in an interview.
